There are enough reviews to give you a gist of what this series is about so I will just add my $.02:

Heartland is worth watching. For everyone.
The plot is so real, always. Nothing too cheesy, things don't always work out. Conflict and joy, love and broken dreams - all so normal and true to life. Characters are fantastic. Some you like, some you don't, some surprise you - real life. I was so disappointed when I found out that Heartland isn't a working ranch all year... I wanted so badly to visit and enter the world. Still thinking of visiting High River, Alberta (at the foot of the mountains near Calgary, where this show is set).
Gorgeous views, beautiful mountains, rivers, meadows. Lots of care and good hearts that make you believe in humanity, while at the same time preserving your cynicism by showing the tough and the weary. Yes, people hurt people, drugs and alcohol can kill your life, money can blind you, etc., but there is also goodness and life.
This season, season 7, is particularly well done. You will finish off feeling satisfied and warm. I highly recommend it for all ages. (Although it may be hard to explain side themes such as drugs to younger children)
SPOILERS:
Ashley comes back... and leaves. Lisa comes back... and stays.

I love Heartland--it's family-oriented and has interesting characters and plot lines.  I must confess though, that I wanted to write this review so that I could discuss the packaging/discs included and see if anyone else had a similar issue.  My mother ordered season 7 and discovered that all of the episodes were the exact same ones that were on her season 6 DVD.  Was this a mistake of mis-packaging?  I am so confused by this.  Are there different versions of the show and we possibly ordered the wrong version?  Please chime in if you have any thoughts on this--very odd, and we don't want to miss out on any episodes.  Amazon refunded her money on Season 7...but what do we do now? Go on to season 8?  If we order again, might we get a season 7 with new episodes?

I was really involved with this series, especially with Graham Wardel's brilliant depiction of Ty, until the point where the producers tastelessly insert the Arab Prince, Ahmed, into the plot. In the manner you'd expect of one the ME's royal families, Ahmed tries to "buy" Amy's heart. Ty handily puts an end to Ahmed's first go at Amy. but then a few episodes later, Ahmed is back, again throwing exorbitant sums of $ at Amy. It's at this point that the story too far exceeds the boundaries of decency. I worked in the ME for 21 years and knew the royal families more than I wanted to. I know they knew about 9/11 before it happened and were funding it. Further, all along they have bribing the Islamic extremists not to come at Saudi Arabia and Jordan with huge amounts of money-just as this dirt bag Ahmed tries to "buy" Amy, not once but twice. In short, the royal families of Saudi Arabia and Jordan, the two kingdoms in the ME, are over their gutras in the blood of American soldiers. I think Ty and Amy will wind up OK. But I don't care at this point. The producers have given an indecent, massive overdose of this obnoxious Arab prince.  So for this Heartland, kalas (Arabic for enough)!

One of the best family dramas I have ever watched.  I was hooked when I bought the first season, now I can't wait for each season to come out on DVD.  I am now thoroughly invested in the lives of each of the characters.  The story is about the inner workings of a close-knit family along with all the day to day personal dramas and personality clashes created by the characters themselves, while intertwining it with the story of a girl who can "mend" broken horses with her ability to connect with them in a special way.  Best show ever; I will be a very sad person when this show comes to an end!  I highly recommend it if you are looking for a show with laughs, heartache, warmth, drama, love, family values, and basically, a lot of heart!
